title: sesame edamame
ingredients: 1-2 Tbsp black sesame; broken up in mortar and pestle
pinch or two of kosher salt
instructions: Place the edamame directly on a baking sheet and broil on high, flipping around until browned with a bit of char; maybe 7â€“15 minutes.
Once cooked, take the edamame out and into a bowl.  Mix in the remaining ingredients, tossing really well so that the sesame seeds and salt stick to the edamame.
Serve with an extra bowl for the edamame shells.
notes: If you can't find togarashi, a little red pepper flake or gochugaru will work.
